description: Via Latin from Greek Θρασων (a boastful soldier in Terence’s Eunuchus), from θρασυς ‘bold, spirited’.

adjectives.description: thrasonical (comparative more thrasonical, superlative most thrasonical)

entries.meaning: Like Thraso (a character in the play Eunuchus by Terence); boastful, bragging, vainglorious.
examples: The Sorbonicall clamours (which at Paris I haue ſene in time paſt whē poperie moſt raigned) might be worthily thought in compariſon of thys traſonicall oſtentation to haue had much modeſtie.
